summary: If someone infringes on your patent, you can sue—if you can afford millions of dollars in legal fees. Or you can use "third-party litigation funding," which is when an unrelated company pays for the lawsuit in exchange for some of the proceeds if the case succeeds. A substantial proportion of patent lawsuits are estimated to be funded this way. Most plaintiffs aren't required to disclose...
title: Intellectual Property: Information on Third-Party Funding of Patent Litigation
